Issues.Title: build: update dependency express to v4.19.2 [security]
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [express](http://expressjs.com/) ([source](https://togithub.com/expressjs/express)) | dependencies | minor | [`4.18.3` -> `4.19.2`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/express/4.18.3/4.19.2) |

### GitHub Vulnerability Alerts

#### [CVE-2024-29041](https://togithub.com/expressjs/express/security/advisories/GHSA-rv95-896h-c2vc)

### Impact

Versions of Express.js prior to 4.19.2 and pre-release alpha and beta versions before 5.0.0-beta.3 are affected by an open redirect vulnerability using malformed URLs.

When a user of Express performs a redirect using a user-provided URL Express performs an encode [using `encodeurl`](https://togithub.com/pillarjs/encodeurl) on the contents before passing it to the `location` header. This can cause malformed URLs to be evaluated in unexpected ways by common redirect allow list implementations in Express applications, leading to an Open Redirect via bypass of a properly implemented allow list.

The main method impacted is `res.location()` but this is also called from within `res.redirect()`.

### Patches

https://github.com/expressjs/express/commit/0867302ddbde0e9463d0564fea5861feb708c2dd
https://github.com/expressjs/express/commit/0b746953c4bd8e377123527db11f9cd866e39f94

An initial fix went out with `express@4.19.0`, we then patched a feature regression in `4.19.1` and added improved handling for the bypass in `4.19.2`.

### Workarounds

The fix for this involves pre-parsing the url string with either `require('node:url').parse` or `new URL`. These are steps you can take on your own before passing the user input string to `res.location` or `res.redirect`.

### References

[https://github.com/expressjs/express/pull/5539](https://togithub.com/expressjs/express/pull/5539)
[https://github.com/koajs/koa/issues/1800](https://togithub.com/koajs/koa/issues/1800)
https://expressjs.com/en/4x/api.html#res.location

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>expressjs/express (express)</summary>

### [`v4.19.2`](https://togithub.com/expressjs/express/blob/HEAD/History.md#4192--2024-03-25)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/expressjs/express/compare/4.19.1...4.19.2)

\==========

-   Improved fix for open redirect allow list bypass

### [`v4.19.1`](https://togithub.com/expressjs/express/blob/HEAD/History.md#4191--2024-03-20)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/expressjs/express/compare/4.19.0...4.19.1)

\==========

-   Allow passing non-strings to res.location with new encoding handling checks

### [`v4.19.0`](https://togithub.com/expressjs/express/blob/HEAD/History.md#4190--2024-03-20)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/expressjs/express/compare/4.18.3...4.19.0)

\==========

-   Prevent open redirect allow list bypass due to encodeurl
-   deps: cookie@0.6.0

</details>

---

Issues.Title: HttpTransferCache should allow caching of requests with auth headers
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Previously, we were able to use hydration/http caching with all of our requests from the server to the client. With 17.3.0 (https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/54746) caching was killed for all requests with authorization headers, but with enterprise applications, this is almost always the case. Therefore, hydration does not occur properly and the application behaves poorly. 

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

17.3.0

### Anything else?

A solution would be to revert this behavior, or to add a configurable bit to the withHttpTransferCacheOptions config. As is, this prevents myself and likely others from upgrading past 17.2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "HttpTransferCache should allow caching of requests with auth headers" (#55031)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): allow external projects to use provided compiler options
Issues.Body: When creating the Angular Language Service instance, attempts to read configuration files are now only attempted if the project is considered a `Configured` project. Such a project has been analyzed by TypeScript and one or more configuration files (tsconfig/jsconfig) files have been found for the project. External projects are loaded via API which allows compiler options to be provided programmatically.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(language-service): allow external projects to use provided compiler options" (#55035)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): throw error if item name and context variables conflict
Issues.Body: Based on some internal feedback, these changes add validations to prevent cases where the `@for` loop variable name is the same as one of the built-in context variables, or when one of the context variables is aliased to the same name as the item.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(compiler): throw error if item name and context variables conflict" (#55045)

Issues.Title: Calling markAllAsTouched() on parent form doesn't mark ControlContainer controls as touched
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

1. Have a component with ControlContainer that is looking at a FormGroup in the parent form.
2. From the parent component, call form.markAllAsTouched().
3. Use devtools to observe the behavior. In the actual FormGroup object, the controls are correctly marked as touched, however, in the DOM, you will be able to see the controls inside the ControlContainer component aren't touched.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-control-container-subform-markallastouched-bug?file=src%2Fmain.ts

Issues.Title: feat(http): exclude caching for authenticated HTTP requests
Issues.Body:
This update modifies the transfer cache logic to prevent caching of HTTP requests that require authorization. To opt-out from this behaviour use the `includeAuthorizationRequests` option in `withHttpTransferCache`

BREAKING CHANGE: By default we now prevent caching of HTTP requests that require authorization . To opt-out from this behaviour use the `includeAuthorizationRequests` option in `withHttpTransferCache`.

Example:
```ts
withHttpTransferCache({
  includeAuthorizationRequests: true,
})
```

Closes: #54745
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(http): exclude caching for authenticated HTTP requests" (#55034)

Issues.Title: build: address pre-release validation failure
Issues.Body:
Previously, the release process encountered an error due to ts-node's inability to transform `packages/schematics/angular/utility/latest-versions.ts`, resulting in the following error:

```
export const latestVersions: Record<string, string> & {
^^^^^^

SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'export'
    at internalCompileFunction (node:internal/vm:73:18)
    at wrapSafe (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1274:20)
    at Module._compile (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1320:27)
    at Module._extensions..js (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1414:10)
    at Module.load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1197:32)
    at Module._load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1013:12)
    at ModuleWrap.<anonymous> (node:internal/modules/esm/translators:202:29)
    at ModuleJob.run (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:195:25)
    at async ModuleLoader.import (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:336:24)
    at async checkSchematicsAngularLatestVersion (file:///usr/..../git/angular-cli/scripts/release-checks/dependency-ranges/latest-versions-check.mts:9:46)
```

To resolve this issue, we now utilize the `package.json` directly to retrieve dependency versions.

(cherry picked from commit 7682a7145f817241f6e4dc6036f1334b16efb235)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: address pre-release validation failure" (#27370)

Issues.Title: Types disappearing (or heavily simplified) if not using `npm link`
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

After porting [openapi-fetch](https://github.com/drwpow/openapi-typescript/tree/main/packages/openapi-fetch) to Angular, I noticed that once I installed the library through the npm registry (`npm install openapi-fetch-angular` instead of `npm link ../openapi-fetch-angular/dist/openapi-fetch-angular`), all types became different from what they were, despite the node_modules/openapi-fetch-angular differing only one file: the .npmignore with the following content.
```
# Nested package.json's are only needed for development.
**/package.json
```

When using `npm link` to a local dist of the project, the types are correct, and will error if I attempt to use an invalid path, "/", in this case. Note that this is intended behaviour. Only requests to known paths should be allowed.
![image](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/17461028/19828917-f740-4c1e-90ed-b5acac97f43f)

As soon as I install it using `npm install openapi-fetch-angular` most types somehow disappear.
![image](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/17461028/14d4a27a-4431-4513-8e69-fa4edd9be097)


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/devolite/openapi-fetch-angular-example/tree/1e48a26b348cad9c4fe779a0a8433bc8eb13ae51

_No response_

```true
typescript                      5.4.3
zone.js                         0.14.4
```


### Anything else?

Steps to reproduce:
1) Clone both repositories in one directory ([openapi-fetch-angular-example](https://github.com/devolite/openapi-fetch-angular-example) and [openapi-fetch-angular](https://github.com/devolite/openapi-fetch-angular)).
2) Install and build the `openapi-fetch-angular` package.
3) Install the `openapi-fetch-angular-example` packages but instead of using the npm package, use `npm link ../openapi-fetch-angular-example/dist/openapi-fetch-angular`.
4) Check the types on the client, it should work.
5) Now use `npm install openapi-fetch-angular`.
6) Types are now heavily simplified and missing.

I did a `diff -r` of both node_module folders, here's the result:
```diff
diff -r nm1/.package-lock.json nm2/.package-lock.json

8309,8318c8320,8321

---
```

Issues.Title: build: address pre-release validation failure
Issues.Body:
Previously, the release process encountered an error due to ts-node's inability to transform `packages/schematics/angular/utility/latest-versions.ts`, resulting in the following error:

```
export const latestVersions: Record<string, string> & {
^^^^^^

SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'export'
    at internalCompileFunction (node:internal/vm:73:18)
    at wrapSafe (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1274:20)
    at Module._compile (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1320:27)
    at Module._extensions..js (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1414:10)
    at Module.load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1197:32)
    at Module._load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1013:12)
    at ModuleWrap.<anonymous> (node:internal/modules/esm/translators:202:29)
    at ModuleJob.run (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:195:25)
    at async ModuleLoader.import (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:336:24)
    at async checkSchematicsAngularLatestVersion (file:///usr/..../git/angular-cli/scripts/release-checks/dependency-ranges/latest-versions-check.mts:9:46) 
```

To resolve this issue, we now utilize the `package.json` directly to retrieve dependency versions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: address pre-release validation failure" (#27366)

Issues.Title: stylePreprocessorOptions.includePath is not following symlinks when using @angular-devkit/build-angular:application
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### Description

I'm trying to include an .scss file from an external project that is symlinked into my angular project for development purposes.

Given the `library` symlink in this path:

`<project-root>/lib/@scope/(->library)/_index.scss`

and this configration in angular.json:

```json
"stylePreprocessorOptions": {
  "includePaths": [
    "lib",
    "node_modules"
  ]
}
```

referencing the stylesheet like this:

`@use '@scope/library' as lib;`

does not work using `@angular-devkit/build-angular:application`.

It does however work using `@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser`.

### Minimal Reproduction

- Create a new angular project
- Add a `lib` folder.
- Add a symlinked directory to the `lib` folder 
- Add `lib` to `stylePreprocessorOptions.includePaths`
- Reference an .scss file from the symlinked directory.
- Run `ng serve`.

### Exception or Error

```text
✘ [ERROR] Can't find stylesheet to import.
  ╷
1 │ @use '@scope/lib' as lib;
  │ ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  ╵
  src\styles.scss 1:1  root stylesheet [plugin angular-sass]

    angular:styles/global:styles:1:8:
      1 │ @import 'src/styles.scss';
        ╵         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 17.3.0
Node: 20.11.1
Package Manager: npm 10.2.4
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 17.3.0
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, material, material-luxon-adapter, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1703.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   17.3.0
@angular-devkit/core            17.3.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      17.3.0
@schematics/angular             17.3.0
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.4.2
zone.js                         0.14.4
```


### Anything else relevant?

The behavior is different when explicitly referencing the stylesheet like this:

`@use '@scope/library/_index.scss' as lib;`

or

`@use '@scope/library/index' as lib;`

Then it finds the file within `node_modules` where it is also present (since the library I'm symlinking into my project is normally a regular npm dependency). So `@use '@scope/library' as lib;` throws an error, `@use '@scope/library/_index.scss' as lib;` ignores the symlink and finds the file elsewhere.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "stylePreprocessorOptions.includePath is not following symlinks when using @angular-devkit/build-angular:application" (#27353)

Issues.Title: The relative path image in the scss file is not added with base-href after ng build.
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

In ng v10.x, the result of the build is as expected. ‼️ 

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

**1、scss file**

/* src/style.scss*/
/* this file config in  styles of angular.json */
```
@import 'src/app/components/foo.scss';
```

/* src/app/components/foo.scss*/
```
$faceImg: './face.png';
.icon-face {
    background-image: url($faceImg);
}
```
There is a “face.png” picture in the folder：src/app/components 

**2、build command**
`ng build --base-href /login-app/ --deploy-url  /login-app/` 

**3、build result** 
```
.icon-face {
     background-image: url('face.xxxx.png')
}
```
Our project is a micro front-end, the base-href of the project is not included in window.location.url. As a result, the image cannot be obtained after ng build. ‼️

**4、expect base-href in url**
```
.icon-face {
     background-image: url('/login-app/face.xxxx.png')
}
```
In ng v10.x, the result of the build is as expected. ‼️ 

### Minimal Reproduction

**commands**
ng build --base-href /login-app/

**packages**
"@angular-devkit/build-angular": "^15.2.9",
"@angular/cli": "^15.2.9",
"@angular/compiler-cli": "^15.2.9",

_No response_

Issues.Title: Is It Possible to Dynamically Select a Proxy Server When Serving an Application?
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Description

I aim to host my application using a proxy. Within my setup, I maintain multiple servers as shown below:

```javascript
const servers = {
  dev: 'http://dev.example.com/api',
  stg1: 'http://stg1.example.com/api',
  stg2: 'http://stg2.example.com/api',
  stg3: 'http://stg3.example.com/api',
  stg4: 'http://stg4.example.com/api',
  stg5: 'http://stg5.example.com/api',
  stg6: 'http://stg6.example.com/api',
  // More servers listed here...
  stg30: 'http://stg30.example.com/api',
}
```

In my `proxy.conf.mjs` file, I aim to dynamically select the server based on a provided parameter. I've contemplated using a command like `npm run serve --proxy stg3` and utilizing the target: `servers[proxy]`. 

Is this achievable? Alternatively, can I pass a flag via the command line to capture it within `proxy.conf.mjs`? Or perhaps, is there a way to send a flag and disable the "is not found in schema" error for this purpose?

### Describe the solution you'd like

_No response_

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

Issues.Title: M3 prebuilt themes
Issues.Body:
Includes the following changes:

### fix(material-experimental/theming): avoid re-emitting the same tokens from the backwards-compatibility styles
Currently the color variant backwards-compatibility styles emit all tokens, even though they were likely emitted already by the theme. This ends up increasing the theme size by about 50kb.

These changes add a `emit-overrides-only` parameter to the token utilities and use it to only emit the palette-specific styles from the backwards-compatibility mixin.

### feat(material/core): add prebuilt themes based on M3 
Adds four new prebuilt themes that are using Material Design 3.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "M3 prebuilt themes" (#28779)

Issues.Title: bug(Layout): createEmptyStyleRule not adding nonce correctly in Chrome
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The style element that is created with the function createEmptyStyleRule does not have the CSP nonce when the site is serving in Chrome.

The nonce is added the following way:
`mediaQueryStyleNode.nonce = nonce;` [see here](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/d38798a474278c3d4b1533ae3ad7273786be9372/src/cdk/layout/media-matcher.ts#L68)

But it should be done this way I think:
`mediaQueryStyleNode.addAttribute('nonce', nonce); `

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-4szyku?file=src%2Findex.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new Angular project
2. Add `ngCspNonce="RANDOM_CSP_NONCE_PLACEHOLDER"` to the `app-root` component in index.html
3. Add Angular material to the project
4. Add an Material Module to the appComponent (for example: MatSlideToggleModule)
5. Serve the application and open the site in Chrome
6. Inspect the rendered HTML


### Expected Behavior

<style type="text/css" nonce="RANDOM_CSP_NONCE_PLACEHOLDER"></style>

### Actual Behavior

<style type="text/css"></style>

### Environment

- Angular:  17.3.0
- CDK/Material: 17.3.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, MacOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Layout): createEmptyStyleRule not adding nonce correctly in Chrome" (#28780)

Deprecation warning shows when using @angular/google-maps.

As soon as map-marker component is loaded in app the warning is shown in console.
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/57639646/fd8ca771-9a8c-422a-8164-dee43c638829)


According to google [google.maps.Marker](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/marker) is now legacy and [google.maps.marker.AdvancedMarkerElement](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/advanced-markers) should be used instead. 

In the code for example [map-marker.ts](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/70d416fe3f04c0088419d64c8f4d7465f80be281/src/google-maps/map-marker/map-marker.ts#L290) we can see that the legacy code is being used.

Please see https://developers.google.com/maps/deprecations for additional details and https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/advanced-markers/migration for the migration guide.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. git grep google.maps.Marker


### Expected Behavior

To use google.maps.marker.AdvancedMarkerElement instead of google.maps.Marker

### Actual Behavior

google.maps.Marker is used in map-marker.ts and deprecated warning is shown in console.

### Environment

- CDK/Material: 13.3.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11

Issues.Title: bug(MatFormField): mat-label overlays prefix mat-icon in outline mat-form-field in tab groups
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14

### Description

This problem is incredibly corner case, but if you use:
1. a mat-form-field with appearance="outline",
2. containing a mat-icon with the matPrefix or matIconPrefix directive,
3. along with a mat-label,
5. and the mat-form-field is within a mat-tab in a mat-tab-group,
6. and is _not the first tab_ in the mat-tab-group

then the mat-label will overlay the prefix icon. 

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/vdcxsa-sre18u?file=src%2Fexample%2Fform-field-appearance-example.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. You will see the form field is fine in tab One
2.  and broken in tab Two.




### Expected Behavior

I expect the mat-label to appear to the right of the prefix icon

### Actual Behavior

The mat-label overlays the prefix icon. In fact I think it starts a bit to the left of it out of view.

### Environment

- Angular: ng15, ng16, or ng17
- CDK/Material: 15, 16, 17
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System: macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatFormField): mat-label overlays prefix mat-icon in outline mat-form-field in tab groups" (#28776)

Issues.Title: bug(MatTable): Nested MatTable's rows have no border if I expand last row of parent MatTable
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When I have a nested MatTable set with expand feature, when I expand the last row of the parent table, all the cells in the child MatTable will have no border.
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/65027545/dbbc6ed3-0e3b-46e3-ada7-d45e95e29772)

But If I am expanding any other rows except the last row, the nested MatTable is displaying fine.
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/65027545/7575e8d5-770d-4526-94ba-659906241e6e)

I have found the reason that the styles from last row .mat-cell of the parent MatTable is being applied to all the child MatTable's .mat-cell

![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/65027545/1831a5c1-ba1a-4783-b86d-34578ce260b6)



### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/5djdhn?file=src%2Fexample%2Ftable-expandable-rows-example.ts
Steps to reproduce:
1. Expand the 1st row of the MatTable and check row borders
2. Expand the last row of the MatTable and checkl the absence of row borders of the rows


### Expected Behavior

Only the last row of the nested MatTable will be applied with the `border-bottom: none` styles. not all the rows

### Actual Behavior

Every row inside the last row of MatTable's child MatTable is applied with `border-bottom: none` styles.

### Environment

Angular CLI: 17.0.1
Node: 18.19.0
Package Manager: npm 10.2.3
OS: win32 x64

... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

Issues.Title: feat(OVERLAY): All overlays should use the Popover API (once it reaches stable)
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

The [Popover API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Popover_API) should be used for overlay and, therefore, by extension, dialog, tooltips, select and more.

This feature should be implemented using feature detection because of Firefox probably and some more obscure browsers. The [Popover API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Popover_API) should be used for overlay and, therefore, by extension, dialogue, tooltips, select and more.

### Use Case

If some other API would be using the Popover API and the angular components would not, it would mean, that Angular would stay behind.

Ex: Having a `matTooltip` inside a native `<dialog>` element does show the tooltip behind the dialog and its backdrop.
https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-4wx2az
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(OVERLAY): All overlays should use the Popover API (once it reaches stable)" (#28769)

Issues.Title: feat(material/checkbox): MatCheckbox is missing support for aria-expanded attribute
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Based on documentation for [`aria-expanded`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Attributes/aria-expanded#associated_roles) one of the roles with which this attribute is associated with is `role=checkbox`. There is currently no way of providing this `aria-expanded` attribute to the input element generated by MatCheckbox component.

Additionally based on the documentation provided `aria-controls` and `aria-owns` are also missing to indicate to the user which section the output of this input will affect. 

Also see further discussion on [extending support to role=radio](https://github.com/w3c/aria/issues/1404)

### Use Case

Checkbox toggle status expands a related section with further options/information. Screen reader should be able to inform the user of any sections expanded/collapsed as a result of their action

Before
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/14091858/bdec082b-82fa-4ca9-87b6-80bf8dcc3c08)

After
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/14091858/3edbfe0b-c0fc-4ca9-b657-658b475da267)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(material/checkbox): MatCheckbox is missing support for aria-expanded attribute" (#28761)
